title: Chinese Government donates 322 tablets to El Salvador's Ministry of Culture
description: On November 13, 2020, the Charge d'affaires from the Chinese Embassy in El Salvador Huang Kunyu attended the tablet computer donation ceremony for the Ministry of Culture of the Government of El Salvador. The donation consisted of 322 Huawei brand tablets. The monetary value of the donated tablets is unknown. Ministry of Culture Chief of Staff, Mariemm Pleitez, received the donation on behalf of the Government of El Salvador. The tablets were to be made available to the public through services in cultural spaces like museums, theaters and parks. According to the Ministry of Culture, this donation would also enable modernization of spaces and strengthen biosecurity measures implemented by the government to prevent COVID-19 infections.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government donates 322 tablets to El Salvador's Ministry of Culture

# Description
On November 13, 2020, the Charge d'affaires from the Chinese Embassy in El Salvador Huang Kunyu attended the tablet computer donation ceremony for the Ministry of Culture of the Government of El Salvador. The donation consisted of 322 Huawei brand tablets. The monetary value of the donated tablets is unknown. Ministry of Culture Chief of Staff, Mariemm Pleitez, received the donation on behalf of the Government of El Salvador. The tablets were to be made available to the public through services in cultural spaces like museums, theaters and parks. According to the Ministry of Culture, this donation would also enable modernization of spaces and strengthen biosecurity measures implemented by the government to prevent COVID-19 infections.
justification: Project involves donation of technology for public cultural services and COVID-19 prevention, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Tablet donation for cultural spaces, modernization of spaces, COVID-19 biosecurity measures

title: China donates anti-epidemic materials to El Salvador Ministry of Tourism in November 2020
description: On November 12, 2020, Charge d'Affaires Huang Kunyu and El Salvador Tourism Minister Valdez attended a donation ceremony of Chinese anti-epidemic materials to the El Salvador Ministry of Tourism. The monetary value of the donated materials is unknown.    According to the Chinese Embassy in El Salvador, Charge d'affaires Huang Kunyu spoke at the ceremony and stated that this donation of anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of Tourism of El Salvador will help El Salvador fight the epidemic and restart the tourism industry. Kunyu also emphasized the importance of tourism cooperation with El Salvador and China’s willingness to explore the potential of tourism cooperation between the two countries.

title: Chinese Embassy donated medical supplies and emergency food kits in November 2020 to Nejapa, El Salvador
description: On November 2, 2020, Charge d'Affaires Huang Kunyu met with Randa Wilde, the Coordinator of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Municipal Government of Nejapa, El Salvador. During this meeting, Huang Kunyu donated medical supplies and emergency food kits on behalf of the Chinese embassy in El Salvador. The monetary value and specific nature of the donation is unknown.

title: China donates living materials to El Salvador's 'Three Borders' area in June 2020
description: On June 13, 2020, Ambassador Ou Jianhong and El Salvador Vice President Ulloa attended the handover ceremony for the donation of living materials from China to El Salvador's "Three Borders" area. The Political Counselor of the Embassy Huang Kunyu, officials from the Ministry of Agriculture of El Salvador, mayors of 8 cities including Metapan City in the Santa Ana Province, and representatives of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) attended the event. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.   According to the Chinese Embassy in El Salvador, El Salvador Vice President Ulloa spoke at the ceremony and thanked China for providing living materials. He stated that a recent passage of tropical storms has made living situations difficult and China's assistance will ease the production and living difficulties of local citizens in El Salvador.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China donates living materials to El Salvador's 'Three Borders' area in June 2020

# Description
On June 13, 2020, Ambassador Ou Jianhong and El Salvador Vice President Ulloa attended the handover ceremony for the donation of living materials from China to El Salvador's "Three Borders" area. The Political Counselor of the Embassy Huang Kunyu, officials from the Ministry of Agriculture of El Salvador, mayors of 8 cities including Metapan City in the Santa Ana Province, and representatives of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) attended the event. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.   According to the Chinese Embassy in El Salvador, El Salvador Vice President Ulloa spoke at the ceremony and thanked China for providing living materials. He stated that a recent passage of tropical storms has made living situations difficult and China's assistance will ease the production and living difficulties of local citizens in El Salvador.
justification: Project involves humanitarian aid with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of living materials to assist with post-storm recovery, focus on humanitarian relief

title: Chinese government donates USD 100,000 in emergency humanitarian aid to El Salvador Ministry of Interior in June 2020
description: On June 10, 2020, Ambassador Ou Jianhong and the El Salvadoran Interior Minister attended the handover ceremony of emergency humanitarian assistance, worth USD $100,000, provided by the Chinese government to El Salvador. Huang Kunyu, Political Counselor of the Chinese embassy, ​​and Hernandez, Director of the Disaster Relief Bureau of the Ministry of Interior, attended the meeting.  During the ceremony, Ambassador Ou stated that El Salvador had been hit by severe storms recently, including tropical storms “Amanda” and Cristobal” in succession. These storms caused huge casualties and property losses.   Part of the provided aid will be invested in the construction of the New Coronary Pneumonia Hospital of the El Salvador International Convention and Exhibition Center (CIFCO), and a portion of it will be used to help the disaster-stricken people rebuild their homes.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese government donates USD 100,000 in emergency humanitarian aid to El Salvador Ministry of Interior in June 2020

# Description
On June 10, 2020, Ambassador Ou Jianhong and the El Salvadoran Interior Minister attended the handover ceremony of emergency humanitarian assistance, worth USD $100,000, provided by the Chinese government to El Salvador. Huang Kunyu, Political Counselor of the Chinese embassy, ​​and Hernandez, Director of the Disaster Relief Bureau of the Ministry of Interior, attended the meeting.  During the ceremony, Ambassador Ou stated that El Salvador had been hit by severe storms recently, including tropical storms “Amanda” and Cristobal” in succession. These storms caused huge casualties and property losses.   Part of the provided aid will be invested in the construction of the New Coronary Pneumonia Hospital of the El Salvador International Convention and Exhibition Center (CIFCO), and a portion of it will be used to help the disaster-stricken people rebuild their homes.
justification: Project is focused on emergency humanitarian aid and disaster relief, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Emergency humanitarian assistance, disaster relief focus, aid for hospital construction and home rebuilding

title: Chinese Embassy donates 3,000 masks to Attorney General's Office of El Salvador in May 2020
description: On May 19, 2020, Chinese Ambassador Ou Jianhong met with El Salvador Attorney General, Raúl Melara, and donated 3,000 masks to the Attorney General’s Office of El Salvador. During the meeting, the two also exchanged views on China and El Salvador's joint fight against the COVID-19 epidemic and judicial cooperation between the two countries. The monetary value of the donated goods is unknown.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: China donates PPE and thermometers to El Salvador in April 2020
description: On April 22, 2020, a batch of anti-epidemic medical supplies donated by the Chinese government arrived at the Salvador Romero International Airport in El Salvador. The donation included 10,000 N95 masks, 2,000 sets of protective suits, gloves, parasols, shoe covers, and 300 thermometers. Ambassador Ou Jianhong from the Chinese Embassy held a handover ceremony with the Deputy Minister of Health, Alvarenga, and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Victor Lagos. Yao Ming, the Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Chinese Embassy and others attended the ceremony. The monetary value of the donated goods is unknown.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

Ambassador Ou Jianhong from the Chinese Embassy held a handover ceremony with the Deputy Minister of Health, Alvarenga, and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Victor Lagos. title: Chinese Embassy donates USD 250,000 to El Salvador for pandemic relief in March 2020
description: On March 18, 2020, the Chinese Ambassador in El Salvador, Oi Jianhong, provided a USD $250,000 donation to Minister Mario Durán on behalf of the Chinese Government. This monetary donation will be used in El Salvador’s efforts to fight against the pandemic.
staff_comments: 1. The two twitter sources (Source ID #157892 and #157893) are from an official recipient source, but other sources could not be found.
